p: ( E)-Cinnamaldehyde-rich oils, such as cassia ( Cinnamomum cassia (L.) J. Presl) [ 23] and cinnamon ( Cinnamomum verum J. Presl) bark oil [ 23, 24], carry a risk of embryotoxicity and should be avoided during pregnancy and breastfeeding. Cinnamon bark oil has GRAS status, yet it has been shown to lower the number of nuclei and affect the distribution of embryos in pregnant mice (orally, at 375 mg/kg for 2 weeks) [ 202].
